chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
items.plainText: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

items.text: I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.
items.plainText: I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.

items.text: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.
items.plainText: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.

items.text: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
items.plainText: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

items.text: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;
items.plainText: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

items.text: Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.
items.plainText: Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.

items.text: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.
items.plainText: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.

items.text: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.
items.plainText: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.

items.text: Because thou hast made the LORD, which is my refuge, even the most High, thy habitation;
items.plainText: Because thou hast made the LORD, which is my refuge, even the most High, thy habitation;

items.text: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.
items.plainText: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

items.text: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
items.plainText: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

items.text: They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
items.plainText: They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

items.text: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.
items.plainText: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

items.text: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
items.plainText: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.

items.text: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.
items.plainText: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.

items.text: With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my salvation.
items.plainText: With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my salvation.
